author: protolambda
content: You're running the node on a home network I assume? Search "port forward" on Google, it's similar to a lot of other applications. You want TCP and UDP 9000 to be open for lighthouse

author: protolambda
content: Then the discovery v5 can be effective; via the bootnodes your ip is discovered by other schlesi nodes, and they can connect to you. Right now you're only making outbound connections, and only just started, so your peer count is low

author: protolambda
content: Also, the schlesi config is baked in for the latest lighthouse, so I think you can omit the testnet dir option. Your node then defaults to learning about other peers through the default bootnodes
